abstract: School system in Munster, Ind, makes all-in digital leap, removing all math and science textbooks for its 2,600 students in grades 5 to 12, and replacing them with laptops and interactive computer programs.
snippet: In Munster, Ind., a school system turned to laptops and interactive computer programs in a million-dollar digital makeover that included a rental laptop for every student.
lead_paragraph: In Munster, Ind., a school system turned to laptops and interactive computer programs in a million-dollar digital makeover that included a rental laptop for every student.

headline.main: Out With Textbooks, in With Laptops for an Indiana School District
headline.print_headline: Out With Textbooks, In With Laptops for an Indiana School District
headline.seo: An Indiana School System Goes Digital
